title: This is what gets you chat restricted?
body:
Swain was 3-12-2 and was following me around mid lane taking kills, baiting fights, and running away. Ekko said in main chat that they were going to feed all game and they did, Ekko finished 0-10-2. Vayne said they gave up as well and did nothing all game went 0-9-4. Riven said nothing all game, never helped, just stayed top lane and went 5-13-4. I finished the game at 6-2-2. I destroyed Zed on mid lane. This is the frustration and chat that gets you restricted. Swain and Ekko both went afk towards the end of the game. I am sure there will be some rejects who will say I deserved chat restriction but at the end of the day, no cussing, no swearing, just calling out the trolls who said they were going to troll and then trolled all game. Riot really should stop trying to control every little detail about chat. "If you don't have anything nice to say don't say anything at all.", so all those terrorists around the world, all the bad people in the world, all the rude people in the world, you should just stay silent? What is Riot trying to condition people for? Here is the chat...

Not really.

 This is true in real life, obviously. If someone punches you in the face, you're allowed to punch him back because, if you don't, you'll possibly be further injured. That's self defense, right? Protecting yourself from further harm.

 In League of Legends though, flaming someone isn't self-defense. It actually encourages them to respond, and you get into those very negative flame wars that the OP's chat log showcases. The only way to **prevent** being further flamed is to mute and say nothing. What the OP did was unnecessarily aggressive and not welcome in this game. He made a bad situation worse instead of better.
League is the only time I've ever seen people defending someone that is intentionally trying to dick over 4 people.

Stop throwing insults. Just play. If you want to offer advice, or make suggestions, fine. But "you suck in this League round and are therefore trolling" does not count. If you suspect someone is griefing, report them, and the tribunal will analyze the player's history carefully. But you don't get a free ride on being an ass in chat just because someone's having a bad game or you THINK they're griefing.

Chances are, those people you were playing with will also get bans for feeding, if they're comments in chat were as damning as you say they are. That's how the system works. Everyone who deserves a ban gets a ban, including you.
